job description:
# Description

HII\-Mission Driven Innovative Solutions, Inc\. \(HII\-MIS\) is America?s largest military shipbuilding company and a provider of professional services to partners in government and industry\. For more than a century, HII?s Newport News and Ingalls shipbuilding divisions in Virginia and Mississippi have built more ships in more ship classes than any other U\.S\. naval shipbuilder\. HII?s Technical Solutions division provides a wide range of professional services through its Integrated Mission Solutions, Fleet Support, Nuclear and Environmental, and Oil and Gas groups\. Headquartered in Newport News, Virginia, HII employs nearly 37,000 people operating both domestically and internationally\.

HII\-MIS is currently seeking an experienced and energetic Senior Data Scientist to work out of our Fairfax, Virginia office and participate in our data\-centric digital transformation initiatives, as well as assist development and growth of our internal and customer\-facing data analysis and data science capabilities\. HII is a large, technologically advanced, geographically dispersed organization that supports a wide spectrum of defense and commercial customers\. HII internally collects a tremendous amount of data as part of daily operations\-\- data that includes large scale industrial and manufacturing data, sensor data, and IoT data to support cutting\-edge engineering and technical disciplines\.
  • *Duties and Responsibilities** \(to include but not be limited to the following\):
We are looking for an energetic, enthusiastic data scientist to apply technology and expertise to help us:

+ Develop service delivery models for data analysis and data science projects, and define best practices for data science projects and teams

+ Use existing HII data assets, identify ways to surface insights from the data

+ Execute data profiling and investigative data analysis for initial assessment and proofs of concept;

+ Design and execute data analysis tasks by building appropriate computational models and tools to accomplish the tasks

+ Evaluate analytic results, document findings and brief findings to internal and external customers

+ Stay abreast of technological and market trends with an eye towards strategic capabilities growth

+ Provide solutioning experience with government contracting, to include writing proposals and supporting business development client calls
  • *Qualifications and Experience:**
  • *Required Expertise**
+ Graduate degree \(MS or PhD\), in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Operations Research, Mathematics, or a related scientific discipline\.

+ Ideal candidate will have 4\+ years with the following skills:

+ Multiple programming languages \(e\.g\.:Python, R, Scala, SQL, Matlab\)

+ Natural Language Processing frameworks \(e\.g\.:Stanford CoreNLP, NLTK, spacy\)

+ Distributed computing / machine learning frameworks \(e\.g\., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Theano, Keras\)

+ Big data platforms \(e\.g\., Hadoop/Spark\)

+ Full range data handling and preparation cycle:

+ Identifying and enhancing data collection procedures

+ Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data collected to prepare for subsequent data analysis

+ Building predictive models using machine learning techniques, and communicating their results

+ Selecting relevant features from datasets

+ Building and optimizing classifiers

+ Testing, evaluating and refining created models

+ Presenting analytic results \(ad\-hoc and otherwise\) in a clear manner

+ Creating automated anomaly detection systems

+ Excellent communication and presentation skills \(written and oral\) across all levels are a must\.
  • *Desirable Expertise**
+ Use of BI dashboards and/or visualization tools \(e\.g\., Microsoft PowerBI, Tableau\)

+ Solutioning experience with government contracting, to include proposal writing and support to business development client calls, as needed
  • *Security:**
+ All candidates will be subject to a pre\-employment background investigation and drug screening per HII requirements
  • *About Us**
HII Mission Driven Innovative Solutions \(HII\-MIS\), is a subsidiary of Huntington Ingalls Industries \(HII\); a Fortune 500 company that employs more than 39,000 employees worldwide, with annual revenues of $7\.5 billion \(2017\)\. HII\-MIS executes a number of successful, innovative, and mission?driven contracts throughout the DoD, the IC, and other Federal and State agencies\.

HII\-MIS excels at working with our Government customers who undertake ambitious efforts to modernize their capabilities to deal with today?s dynamic environments\. We offer innovation, technology, experience, and success assisting our customers migrate to new paradigms of operational achievement, while efficiently managing risk\. We bring understanding and expertise; developing and integrating strategic talent to optimize our workforce and drive integration of new and emerging technologies to enhance program performance\. Overall, more than 1,600 HII\-MIS professionals deliver ISO 9001:2008\-certified and CMMI ML3 high\-value solutions to customers worldwide\.

HII\-MIS is an Equal Opportunity Employer EOE/AA Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled
